newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek Intracom signs 7.5 bln drs deal.
newsitem.headline: Greek Intracom signs 7.5 bln drs deal.

text.p: Greece's Intracom signed a 7.5 billion drachma ($29.1 million) deal with OTE telecom to supply 30,000 new cardphones by year-end 1998, it said on Friday.
OTE had ordered 30,000 cardphones from Intracom in 1992 and is repeating the order following the initial order's commercial success, Intracom said.
The Greek telecommunications and software company said it was currently expanding in international markets such as Bulgaria, Rumania, Albania, Armenia, Bosnia and Pakistan.
Its share closed at 9,250 on Friday, after losing 30 drachmas.
